properties.address: ShipShape Health and Wellbeing Centre, The Stables, Sharrow Lane, Sheffield, S11 8AE
properties.description: Established in 2006, ShipShape Health and Wellbeing is an Anchor organisation delivering responsive & preventive services to tackle health and inequality amongst the most deprived communities across the neighbourhoods of Nether Edge, Abbeydale, Highfield, Sharrow, Broomhall, and City Centre. As well as being well connected with city wide partners, groups and communities, through projects and partnership working. Our services are delivered from the centre and out in the community through our outreach team. the centre is open from 9:30am - 4pm. our services are delivered in different community languages through our diverse team of staff.

Monday - Mums and tots group running weekly during term time. - Olive Tree - a social space to asylum seekers and refugees to play games and go to a café. -International café- café for anyone who's first language is not English. -English class - Class for anyone wanting to improve their English. Friday - fortnightly women's bible study. - Youth group for ages 11-18. November - Christianity explored, a place to explore the message of Jesus. We are also hoping to open a workspace for anyone working remotely to come and have a social place to gather and work.

properties.address: 81 Main Road, S9 5HL
properties.description: Free Wi Fi. Hot and cold drinks to welcome people. Music, books and toys/games and creative material for people to use. We also have a range of children and adult clothing which is free. Foodbank is held twice a week by voucher referrals. One day a week there is a Citizens Advice either by appointment or drop-in service for foodbank clients. Money support is available by appointment only. We host a monthly memory cafe for those with dementia prescribed run in co-operation with our local well-being team. There is a private car park and garden with seating for those wishing to enjoy flowers and plants. These activities are led by a small team of volunteers from our area.

hours._text:
Connect Café is a warm, welcoming space for people to come and enjoy snacks, drinks and community.

We are an extension of S6 Foodbank which provides emergency food parcels, and signposts to other organisations for help with housing, benefits, debt and more.

hours._text:
Social Cafe for people recovering from mental illnesses 

Tuesday 2pm - 4 pm
Friday 11 am - 2 pm

We also have a monthly meeting for women with mild to moderate mental health problems - 

Women's weight loss and Gym sessions on Tuesdays 12 - 2 PM

This is in addition to advice sessions on Mondays 9:00 A M till 12 PM and Tuesdays 9:00 AM till 12 PM

properties.title: Firvale Community Hub - Myself My Community Social cafe

properties.address:
The Hope Centre
Bernard Road
Sheffield
S2 5BQ

hours._text:
During our general opening hours we have a Community Grocery and a cafe as well as a nursery in the building.
On certain days we also have a toddler playgroup, over 55s cafe and conversation groups happening too.
Our usual opening times for the cafe are 10-2 and for the community grocery 11-3.
After these times, we will have free hot drink facilities available in our cafe area till 6pm Monday throuh till Friday.

Spend the day, keep warm and take part in the different activities!

properties.title: The Sheffield Foyer

properties.address: The Learning Zone, 320 Wordsworth Ave, Sheffield S5 8NL

hours._text:
This is a new welcoming space for the community to access through winter & will be delivered one morning a week for 12 weeks to provide a safe warm space for the community.

Join us for games/activities/reading materials, warm refreshments and support in accessing services such as welfare, health and wellbeing, employment, housing, etc.
